```{r setup}

library(umncvmstats)
```

## One Sample t-test
```{r}
one_t_test(wt ~ 1, data = mtcars2)
```

### Separately by another categorical variable
```{r}
one_t_test(wt ~ am, data = mtcars2)
```

## Two Sample t-test
```{r}
two_t_test(wt ~ am, data = mtcars2)
```

### together in one table
```{r}
combine_tests(
  one_t_test(wt ~ am, data = mtcars2),
  two_t_test(wt ~ am, data = mtcars2))
```

## Pairwise t-tests
```{r}
combine_tests(
  one_t_test(wt ~ cyl, data = mtcars2),
  pairwise_t_test(wt ~ cyl, data = mtcars2))
```

## Paired t-test
```{r}
combine_tests(
  one_t_test(score1 + score2 ~ 1, data = passfail),
  paired_t_test(score2 - score1 ~ 1, data = passfail))
```

## Log transformations
By default, responses using `log(...)` are back-transformed. 
To keep the result on the log scale, use `backtransform = FALSE`.

```{r}
combine_tests(
  one_t_test(log(wt) ~ am, data = mtcars2, backtransform = FALSE),
  two_t_test(log(wt) ~ am, data = mtcars2, backtransform = FALSE),
  one_t_test(log(wt) ~ am, data = mtcars2),
  two_t_test(log(wt) ~ am, data = mtcars2))

combine_tests(
  one_t_test(log(score1) + log(score2) ~ 1, data = passfail),
  paired_t_test(log(score2) - log(score1) ~ 1, data = passfail))
```
